title: How did Barbara Cartland write so many books so quickly? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s actually relatively easy. You just need a certain level of intelligence and a good imagination, and it comes pouring out of you. They weren’t difficult books to write. There have been times in the past when I have written 5000 word short stories in two hours and they have won competitions.

They were short, not well written Bodice Rippers. Readers finished them in a day, then went out and bought another. No one nominated her for the Nobel Prize for Literature. She cranked them out, and her readers scooped them up. You can’t call her unsuccessful, though.
